data.title: Great Experience!
data.text: The evening that my husband and I ate here, we didn't want too much to eat, so we decided to split a soup and an entrée.  We had the Mulligatawny Soup and Chicken Tikka Masala (spicy) - both were delicious.  The wait staff was friendly and very accommodating to our request to split the meal.  We both like spicy food, so ordering this dish spicy worked for us.

data.title: Tasteee
data.text: Loved the food and the ambiance. Went with the family for dinner so cannot comment about the lunch buffet. The location of the restaurant is in Rockville Town center. Try to visit during Friday night. Friday night is Karaoke night.

data.title: Love the fusion AND the Indian flair!
data.text:
I have been to this restaurant about a dozen times - mostly for the buffet, twice on Mother's Day (my day to choose) and a few times for dinner. The buffet is wonderful for lunch, and absolutely the best buffet in the area. I love Indian food and I have tried them all several times - but this one is my favorite. Service is always friendly and fast.

What inspired me to write a review, though, was on our most recent trip there for dinner. Four of us went, and tried two appetizers and four different dishes - and they were all absolutely delicious. We got pretty bold in our selections, too, trying something different than the typical butter chicken - and it was hard to decide which one was the best. There's a little kick in all the food, making it not your typical Indian. Wonderful.

data.title: Highly recommended
data.text: This was an extremely pleasant experience. We had the buffet, which was just the right size, freshly made, and had a selection of dishes from various parts of India. The service was excellent and the ambience was great. This is a keeper!

data.title: Fantastic Food and Service
data.text: Went for dinner with my husband and the service was excellent. The quality of the food really good and pricing reasonable.  The venue is very close to all the Rockville amenities and parking is practically next door.  I definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves Indian food and likes a nice selection of gluten free options.  We both fell in love with their gluten free cinnamon flan!

data.title: Great food and service!
data.text: Highly recommended place! Excellent food and service. Beautiful, modern but exotic decor. Green salad with carrot dressing was superb and a must try! Chicken tikka masala and naan bread were fantastic!

data.title: I Love this Place
data.text:
Indian food can be tricky to get right. I normally  judge a good Indian restaurant based on my favorite dish: Chicken tikka masala.

Spice Xing does my dish really well. In fact its my favorite place to have it. The chicken meat is thigh. It's lean and full of juicy flavors.  The sauce is thick and creamy and bursts with fresh aromas. 

Main dishes also come with rice, a small salad  and a mix of vegetables. This not only makes the dish look great but also adds extra fresh flavors, that balance well.

For starters I'd recommend either the Tawa Scallpos or the Baby Dosa and drinks, the Ooh La La.

The staff are very attentive,  friendly and professional. For seating, request a boot. Its more comfortable and private

data.title: Indian Cuisine Done Well
data.text:
Spice Xing is one of the best Indian restaurants in the Bethesda, Rockville, Poromac area. We have gone there many, many times. The service is speedy yet thoughtful. And the food is consistently well made. Their appetizer selections are unique - ranging from chicken tikka to chili cheese toasts.

As with any Indian restaurant there are plenty of veggie entrees. The Baigan Burtha is always a good choice. Pairs well with the Tamarind Mojito (replete with a slight spicy kick).

The atmosphere is modern and eclectic -  underplaying the usual Indian motifs but with some flair. 

SX has karaoke nights, that we have successfully avoided over the years. Its not our cup of chai.

data.title: Good Indian Food
data.text: I love the lunch buffet with its numerous array of delicacies. My favorite is the eggplant spicy and delicious. Also the curry goat melts in your mouth. Nice decor, good place for groups. The buffet is Monday through Sunday approximately 10.00. Plenty of parking garages and inexpensive.

data.title: Updated, creative Indian cuisine
data.text: Always reliably delicious.  Cooking with a light touch and well selected spice mix.  A local gem that is worth a trip to Rockville Town Center.

data.title: best Indian food ever
data.text: This is a fabulous restaurant - one of the top ten in rockville.  And always a favorite. The food is consistently good. They have a great ambiance with attentive service.  They also prepare for curbside pickup. Absolutely give it a try.

data.title: Great Indian Buffet
data.text: We have visited several times for the Sunday buffet. The range of dishes is amazing, both meat and vegetarian. A lot of sauces and condiments. Some mild and some spicy.  Breads are less varied now that they are in the serving line instead of bringing to your table. The only drawback to Sunday's is that there are often Large Indian parties which can be a bit noisy. But you can't beat the $15 for all you can eat.

data.title: Surprisingly good
data.text:
I went there on a weekday night with friends which might 
explain why it was rather quiet. There was no menu posted outside so we asked for one. It looked promising, so we stayed and were glad we did. The service was good as might be expected when a place is not busy, but the food was nicely presented and very good. I had the yakhni lamb in a ginger-fennel-mint sauce which I highly recommend, as was the spicy lamb biryani that one of my companions had. The garlic nan was also delicious. There was, of course a sizable vegetarian menu, including vegan choices, and some interesting dishes with a foreign influence. The setting was lovely as well.

data.title: A good dining evening in the middle of winter
data.text: I would say there are better Indian restaurants around but we used Groupon so it was decent. It has a nice ambiance and the staff is efficient.

data.title: Great Spicy!
data.text: The service was wonderful!!!  I didn't have a clue of what to order and our waiter gave use the best suggestions.  My sons and I had a great dinner.

data.title: Very Good
data.text: Salmon was excellent, so was our Samoza's.  Not crowded on Saturday night.  Table could have been a bit cleaner.  Ambiance could be a bit better, too.  But, very good meal overall.

data.title: Spice Xing
data.text: I have eaten at Spice Crossing many times and recently introduced the restaurant to my boyfriend. He loves Indian food and now cannot stop talking about how wonderful the food is at Spice Crossing and how well they use spices in general. We have eaten a second time already. He is ready to go back anytime!

data.title: Worth the Wait
data.text: After a long drive on the way to DC, this was a welcome and rather late night respite. Though closing at 9:30, my boyfriend and I were served at 9 pm and given very welcoming service. The chicken dinner I ordered was perfectly cooked- literally the best chicken I have ever had in an Indian restaurant. Shareable portions and a colorful atmosphere made this meal complete and I would definitely return if in the area again. Thank you livingsocial for pointing us in this direction! Just a note: the parking is rather sparse and paid with quarter meters for the most part.

data.title: Variable food, but great service
data.text:
We went to dinner at Spice Xing in November 2014. We were pleasantly greeted by the maitre d' and led to our table. The restaurant is large, has an open feeling, and is well decorated.

Our food was variable in quality. My daughter's uthappam appetizer and chicken tikka appetizer were both excellent. My malai kofta with garlic naan was also delicious. So far so good. But my wife's shrimp entree was pretty mediocre. She said it was either not fresh or overcooked. She barely ate anyway.

To the credit of the wait staff, they noticed and asked if everything was ok. My wife very rarely complains about food in restaurants, but this time around, she did say something. The restaurant offered to get her another portion which she declined. They did end up taking her entree off the bill which was very nice of them.

I'd have given this restaurant a 4-star rating had it not been for the shrimp.

We'll probably go back, just wouldn't order the shrimp next time.

data.title: Great experience.
data.text:
As an Indian I tend not to go to Indian restaurants too often. Frankly, I find them sub-par as the owners just do not bring a world-class atmosphere and finesse to eateries. It is just like as if we never left our country.

Even, if they are of class they tend to cut corners, or charge patrons stupidly high prices for small portions.

Spice Xing, I feel, maybe has bucked that trend. Great food, good ambiance, good service continually till now that attracts a great clientele.
